sleep_schedule.adjustment_period_advice: Adjust your sleep schedule by shifting bedtime and wake time by 1 hour per day before your trip.
sleep_schedule.recommended_bedtime_local: Adjust your bedtime by 1 hour per day before the trip to align with Dallas time. On the day of departure, aim to sleep around 7:00 PM CDT.
sleep_schedule.recommended_wake_time_local: Adjust your wake time by 1 hour per day before the trip to align with Dallas time. On the day of departure, wake up around 7:00 AM CDT.
sleep_schedule.nap_strategy_advice: If needed, take short naps during the flight or upon arrival to help manage fatigue.

pre_flight_routine: Engage in light cardio, like a brisk walk, to boost energy levels.
Perform stretching exercises to improve flexibility and reduce stiffness during the flight.
Incorporate strength training exercises to counteract the effects of prolonged sitting.
during_flight_movement: Get up and walk around the cabin every hour to improve circulation.
Perform in-seat exercises such as ankle circles, knee raises, and shoulder rolls.
Use compression socks to prevent swelling and blood clots.
post_flight_activity: Take a walk to explore the new city.
Do some stretching to relieve any remaining stiffness.
Consider low-impact activities to avoid overexertion.

timing_adjustment.first_day_breakfast: Have breakfast around 7:00 AM CDT to align with your new time zone.
timing_adjustment.first_day_dinner: Have dinner around 6:00 PM CDT. Try to eat meals at consistent times to help regulate your body clock.

dietary_recommendations: Consume light, easily digestible meals before and during the flight.
Prioritize foods rich in antioxidants to combat oxidative stress.
Limit caffeine and alcohol intake, especially during the flight.

hydration_plan.daily_target_liters: Aim for 2-3 liters of water per day.
hydration_schedule_tips: Drink water consistently throughout the day.
Carry a reusable water bottle to track your intake.
Avoid excessive consumption of sugary drinks and alcohol.
Drink water before, during and after your flight.

light_exposure_advice: Upon arrival in Dallas, avoid morning light exposure. Seek afternoon or evening light to help adjust to the new time zone.
nap_advice: If needed, take short naps during the flight or upon arrival to help manage fatigue.
